title: New & Review: Prison Wine – Transmissions From The Saturnine Heart: Some Bedroom Recordings
content:
I’m not convinced this is ‘new’ as such, more new to me I guess, yet I could find so little information about Prison Wine, that I’d hazard a guess that it’ll be fresh for most people.

This collection of seven bedroom recordings recently uploaded to bandcamp, under the mysterious title ‘Transmissions From The Saturnine Heart: Some Bedroom Recordings‘, is a delicate, moving assortment of lo-fi folk tracks. The searingly poignant Twist The Knife, featuring the chilling line ‘why are you keeping me alive? Go ahead and twist the knife‘, is emotionally cutting in the straightest sense of the word.

There’s a stunning sense of honesty and youthful forgiveness found throughout Transmissions From… such as the plea for understanding that is Help Me (also the newest of the tracks) and the Americana inspired Future Selves. It’s somewhat perplexing as a release, with no tangible name or face to put to it, yet when the music is as engaging and expertly composed as Prison Wine’s, then the complete backstory is hardly needed. The full EP is available to download for free from the Prison Wine bandcamp page; stream Twist The Knife below.
